title:
On local antimagic chromatic numbers of the join of two special families
  of graphs
authors: Gee-Choon Lau and Wai Chee Shiu
abstract:
It is known that null graphs and 1-regular graphs are the only regular graphs
without local antimagic chromatic number. In this paper, we use matrices of
size $(2m+1) \times (2k+1)$ to completely determine the local antimagic
chromatic number of the join of null graphs, $O_m, m\ge 1,$ and 1-regular
graphs of odd components, $(2k+1)P_2$, $k\ge 1$. Consequently, we obtained
infinitely many (possibly disconnected or regular) tripartite graphs with local
antimagic chromatic number 3.
